instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.R7151: What is R7151? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7152: What is R7152? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B turns off without magsafe
threads.message:
The battery is working, tested on different laptops, the OSX shows battery charging and can read the cycle count and so on, however, as soon as magsafe is disconnected the laptop turns off.
Any idea? I have also tested it with different batteries, same result.

The board looks very good, has no burnt part, it went through a light water damage. 

Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B turns off without magsafe
threads.message: check battery sense resistors, measure resistance between pin 17 and 18 from <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, should have about 3 ohm........ if no, check <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR> (2.2 ohm) and <RESISTOR>R7152</RESISTOR> (0 ohm) and traces....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B turns off without magsafe
threads.message: Voltages are all fine(or close to it, i get 2.4v instead of 3 between 17 and 18 and 2.4 on <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR>). any other ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B turns off without magsafe
threads.message: Who asked about voltage???? Where was water damage??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B turns off without magsafe
threads.message:
Sorry i miss-typed ohm, time to go home and sleep!
The water damage was very light, it was around the LVDS and after a ultrasonic bath the board looked very clean. the laptop would even turn on before cleaning and had the same error.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B turns off without magsafe
threads.message: You can read my thread I am having a similar issue. this might help you solve this.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B turns off without magsafe
threads.message: I saw it earlier and it was very interesting, thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B turns off without magsafe
threads.message: Is the battery actually charging? Percents going up?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B turns off without magsafe
threads.message: Yes, you can read all the information related to the battery and it does charge and it's voltage does go up.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B turns off without magsafe
threads.message:
An interesting development, <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> has 7,9v on 1,2,3 instead of 8,35v that it receives on 5 and it has 7v on pin 4(<SIGNAL>CHGR_BGATE</SIGNAL>) instead of 1v that i get on a working board.

I have replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and get the same results.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B turns off without magsafe
threads.message:
OK, lets start over.

Resistance over <CAPACITOR>C7150</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7120</CAPACITOR>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B turns off without magsafe
threads.message: <CAPACITOR>C7150</CAPACITOR> (17,18) 2,5ohm(on working and also on non-working boards) and <CAPACITOR>C7120</CAPACITOR>(27,28) is 19,9ohm on both working and non-working boards.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B turns off without magsafe
threads.message: I really have no idea then. There is no reason this shouldn't work. If you power on with AC+BATT and then remove AC it shuts down? The system should remain under power through the diode in <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> even if <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> is not switched on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B turns off without magsafe
threads.message:
Yes it does turn off as soon as you unplug, Weirdly <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> has a lower voltage on the other side of diode than it receives, on the working board i have 8.35v on pin 5 and exact same 8.35 on pins 1, 2 and 3. on the broken board its 7.9v on 1,2,3, instead of 8.35. 
also on pin 4 i get 1v on the working board and 7v on the broken one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B turns off without magsafe
threads.message: Is the trace ok from <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> to the 6259. Measure the gate of <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> on diode mode
